function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Measles is a highly infectious respiratory virus believed to be predominantly airborne, increasing the risk of widespread transmission in built environments.","Impact":"Unmitigated spread of measles can lead to large-scale outbreaks and potential severe health consequences for unvaccinated individuals.","Mitigation":"Improve ventilation systems, implement air disinfection measures, and promote vaccination to reduce the risk of measles transmission.","Technologies":"UV air disinfection, improved ventilation systems.","People":"Unvaccinated individuals, individuals with compromised immune systems, and those in close contact with infected individuals.","Owner":"Health organizations, building management, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Limited pathogen reductions through air disinfection measures, such as UV, result in less than 1 log of risk reduction, which may be insufficient for effective control of airborne pathogens.","Impact":"Inadequate reduction of airborne pathogens could lead to ongoing pathogen generation and increased risk of disease transmission within built environments.","Mitigation":"Identify and implement additional air disinfection and ventilation strategies to achieve higher pathogen reductions, and conduct regular monitoring of pathogen levels to assess effectiveness.","Technologies":"Advanced air disinfection technologies, improved ventilation designs.","People":"Building management, health organizations, and public health authorities.","Owner":"Building management, health organizations, and ventilation specialists."},{"Description":"The South African study demonstrated that achieving greater protection from airborne pathogens through air changes (ACH) became increasingly challenging, with smaller increments in protection requiring significantly higher equivalent air changes.","Impact":"Increasingly high equivalent air changes for small increments in protection indicate the limitations of relying solely on ventilation for airborne pathogen control in built environments.","Mitigation":"Explore alternative air disinfection technologies and strategies to complement ventilation, and consider the integration of multiple control measures to optimize airborne pathogen control.","Technologies":"Complementary air disinfection technologies, advanced ventilation control systems.","People":"Research institutions, ventilation specialists, public health authorities.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, and building management."}]}
